title.narrative: F.a: CNS advocacy for the benefit of the gatherer reserves

description.narrative: Through the project CNS i) participates in the national level drafting and implementation of public policies regarding the Amazon region gatherer population by negotiating with the government or by confronting its policies in order for the programmes to tr uly reach the local communities, ii) collaborates with the national parliament on drafting the most important laws and directives concerning the Amazon region and iii) supports bringing forward the demands of the regional CNS organisations before the state and federal governments. The project advances the aim of CNS: an ecological agrarian reform, e.g. establishment of different kinds of gatherer reserves, forest conservation and improvement of the quality of life of the people living in them. The latter re sults in the gatherer people remaining in their traditional habitats, which in turn makes it likelier for the forests to remain protected. The project entails the following objectives: establishment of three new collectively managed territories and expansi on of two existing ones, establishment of a new category of collectively managed territories, resolving third parties status and granting of the usufruct permit (CDRU) to four territories, extension of the technical assistance programme (ATER) into the Am azonas and Amapa states, approval of three reserves forest management plans, increase of gatherer products minimum prices by 8 % and inclusion of the Pirarucu fish in the regime, successful inclusion of CNS in the management of the institute in charge of t he reserves under the ministry of environment (ICMBio) by for instance establishing an advisory board parallel to the director of the institute, establishment of Chico Mendes Gatherer Rights Observatory to protect gatherer leaders defending their lands and receiving death threats, as well as strengthening CNS work in Brasilia in order to advance the state level demands there. Within the Brazilian Amazon region approximately 1 500 000 people live within the gatherer reserves or are otherwise connected to the gatherer economy. They all form part of the direct and indirect beneficiaries of the project. The advocacy work is directed towards ministries, institutes functioning under the ministries, the national parliament and the state governments. The national co mmission on traditional communities sustainable development (CNPCT) is an important partner.
